snippet: It is not enough to delay a financial default. Republicans must also reopen the government before negotiations can begin.
abstract: Editorial contends Speaker John Boehner's offer to delay financial default for six weeks without ending the government shutdown is not acceptable; holds House Republicans may have dropped their demand to tie the reopening of government to ending health care reform but they are still using shutdown as a weapon to extract more cuts from the budget without any revenue increases.
lead_paragraph: It is not enough to delay a financial default. Republicans must also reopen the government before negotiations can begin.

headline.main: An Inadequate Offer From the House
headline.print_headline: An Inadequate Offer From the House
